How I pimped my TextMate

TextMate is my editor of choice but it’s not very sexy at first.

Here is how you can make it funkier.

The ProjectPlus plugin gives you SCM status badges (Git, SVN, Mercurial, Bazaar & Svk), it swaps the project drawer to a panel for a less tigerish look, it can display Finder colour labels. It can also save project-tree state and sort files and folders.

The Minimap plugin brings a drawer with a zoomed-out view of your code a la Sublime Text.

Ack in project is a speedy search tool based on ack which gives you clickable results. Super nice!

Other plugins worth trying are XMLMate and TMCodeBrowser for easy XML and code browsing.

Don’t forget the GetBundles to manage your bundles.

For the aesthetics pimping, I use is the Monokai color scheme, Github Web Preview and the green moleskine icon and splash screen.

Now you have the coolest editor that even the VI/Emacs cool kids will envy!
